main event: On May 27, 1957, at 22:15 in Radium Springs, NM, there was a ground-visual observation of a round, blue and white object, the size of a dime at arm's length, hovering stationary for 2-3 minutes before going into a cloud bank.
interesting points: The object was observed by credible witnesses, including a Las Cruces city policeman, a Dona Ana County Sheriff's Department officer, a New Mexico State Patrolman, and a district supervisor from the New Mexico State Police.
The object was seen rising vertically from the top of the Organ Mountains and then disappearing into a cloud bank estimated to be at 20,022ft.
The reliability of all radar operators of the 6553rd ACWRON involved in the sighting was noted to be excellent.
Officers dispatched from the 6553rd ACWRON interviewed separately and their stories coincided as to time, description, and movement.
The opinion of the U.S. Air Force personnel involved was that the objects observed were merely stars rising from behind the mountains.
sighted object: Round, blue and white object hovering stationary
witnesses: Credible witnesses, including law enforcement and U.S. Air Force personnel
